newsitem.title: INDIA: India HDFC 1996/97 net up 27 pct.
newsitem.headline: India HDFC 1996/97 net up 27 pct.

text.p: Note - Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) said it has set dividend at 12.5 percent on preference shares. The equity and preference dividends will absorb 536.0 million rupees and 62.5 million rupees respectively, it said.
The company will be paying 53.6 million rupees in additional taxes, being a new 10 percent tax on dividends announced in the 1997/98 (April-March) budget, the firm said in a statement.
Principal loans in arrears of repayment by borrowers totalled 297.5 million rupees, equivalent to 0.52 percent of HDFC's loan portfolio, it said.
It has transfered 280 million rupees to contingencies taking its total to 704.5 million.
The board decided to raise foreign porfolio holding limits to 30 percent from 24 percent.
The dividend and higher foreign holding limits will be approved by the shareholders at the annual general meeting on June 24.
The share register is closed from June 2 to June 24.
